author: Staff Reporter
text:
Three Salem-based religious trusts have approached the Madras High Court alleging that ‘godman’ Nithyananda is trying to grab the properties of the trusts through a ‘dubious’ suit.

Admitting the civil revision petition, Justice P.R. Shivakumar passed an interim stay against all further proceedings in the suit moved by Nithyananda pending before the Principal Sub Judge, Nagapattinam. According to the petitioners, the ‘godman’ has moved the suit seeking to declare him as the ‘Madadhipathi’ of Sri Somanatha Swami Temple and Mutt in Thiruvarur, Sri Po.Ka. Sathukkal Mutt in Vedaranyam, Sri Arunachal Gnanadesikar Swamigal Mutt in Panchanadhikulam, and Sri Palasamy and Sankarasamy Mutt in Thiruvarur. The petitioners alleged that Nithyananda has made the claim by wrongly projecting a donation to the tune of Rs. two crore that he gave for the mutts as financial assistance and projecting him as an administrator of the trusts. Granting the interim relief, the Judge ordered notice to Nithyananda returnable by March 14.
title: Religious trusts move HC against ‘godman’ Nithyananda
